name: HCC Montblanc

reviews.text: Located right near Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, this is a perfect place to stay and explore Barcelona. Staff were very friendly, rooms were sufficient, and the small bar area is a nice way to meet fellow travelers.
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly staff

reviews.text: Drawbacks: hotel recommended expensive, not so great restaurant two nights in a row. Perhaps they share profits with the restaurant, but you are better off exploring the area and finding your own places to eat. Las Ramblas has a ton of places, especially going down past the market area (Boqueria). Also small side streets near hotel have tons of restaurants.
reviews.title: Ideally located

reviews.text: Hairdryer in room was terrible, if you need to dry your hair, bring your own or be prepared to dry it if for awhile...(especially if you have long hair).
reviews.title: Great location, great value

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from staying at this hotel for 3 nights on a winter getaway weekend with a friend. Faced with a long list of hotels for Barcelona, it was difficult to know which one was best for position, cleanliness, etc. However, I cannot fault this hotel, it was very clean, staff extremely helpful and friendly, buffet breakfast was excellent, huge range of choice from cereals, yoghurts, bread, toast, rolls, croissants, pain au chocolat to cooked eggs, sausages, etc. Breakfast was also open until 11.00am! Our room was fairly small but very clean and pleasant, maid service every day with clean towels, etc. The hotel pool was closed for winter but looking at it, I wouldn't bother getting wet - more like a large bath! The hotel has a restaurant for evening meals but not used much when we were there, there are many restuarants within walking distance. Overall, an excellent hotel with a superb location, 5 min walk from Catalunya where the hop on, hop off tourist bus stops, well worth paying for a 2 day bus pass (22 euros), as you can do the two routes, north and south on 2 consecutive days, getting on and off as much as you like, each loop takes about 2 and a half hours if you don't get off. Las Ramblas just near by too and two of Gaudi's houses. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: really nice place to stay

reviews.text: I booked this hotel by phone having found it on the Internet and got a very good rate - 100 euro for the first night, but it would rise to 140 euro for the next three nights. Decided to stay one night and decide then whether to move. The room was spotless, staff incredibly helpful and pleasant with advice re: metro directions, calling the bus company to check times etc. What impressed me the most was that I decided to book for the next three nights despite the 140 euro price and after booking, the manager voluntarily offered to give me the initial 100 euro rate for the entire stay. Would recommend it to anyone. I was travelling with my 11 year old daughter and we felt very safe. Pool, although small, a lovely place to relax.
reviews.title: excellent

likes.disliked: — make sure you have specific directions before trying to find it!

reviews.title: Good hotel, Good location
reviews.text: Nearly kept this hotel a secret but as we made our decision based on other reviews, felt that was a little unfair! We stayed at the end of June and we were so grateful to have the pool to dip into after a sticky hot (enjoyable) day, even if it was small. Would not hesitate to go back. If you are a first timer to Barcelona, want an efficient hotel, good sized rooms that are clean, comfortable and quiet plus a great location then this is the hotel to go to!

reviews.title: Good deal for the money
reviews.text: The Montblanc is in an excellent location and is a good deal for the money. We paid 89 euro for a double. The rooms are decent size and clean, though they are a bit dated. The pillows are terrible. The employees are very helpful. The breakfast was OK.
If you're looking for luxury, this is not it. But if you want a solid, clean hotel, then this is a good bet.
reviews.title: Good base for the city
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Loved the location: you're right next to a metro station and the centre of Barcelona is 5 minutes walk. Plenty of bars, restaurants and attractions nearby. Try to get a room at the back as the front side is quite noisy from the road. Mind you, pre-requests will probably be ignored as they were for us.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Location
reviews.text: The hotel is a good standard, but the piano bar is pricey and has service without a smile. Just use it as a base. Swimming pool is closed out of season.

reviews.title: Good City Centre Hotel
reviews.text: Just stayed at Mont blanc for three nights November 06,

reviews.title: good
reviews.text: Great location in Barecelona, central to all. However, the beds are uncomfortable, there are no clocks, and the showers are very difficult to use. The problems are more than made up for in the fact that this hotel has one of the best locations in arguably one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

This is a very good hotel for a city break in Barcelona. It is close (but not too close) to Las Rambla - about 5mins walk. The centre of Barcelona is within walking distance, as is the port, zoo area etc. Do note however that a lot of the attractions in Barcelona are quite dispersed. They do however have a good metro system and for the tourist, open top bus routes through the city - you can buy your ticket and hop on and off at every stop or stay on for the 2hr duration. I recommend the orange open tops which depart just outside Hard Rock cafe. They are much less crowded and no queues unlike red bus system.
reviews.title: perfect for city break right in the centre of barca

reviews.text: Hotel Mont Blanc is very clean, rooms are large for a 3star hotel. Air conditioning is excellent and certainly needed at the height of summer. Mini-bar is provided and tv with the usual news channels as standard. Bathrooms are modern and spacious. A major advantage the hotel has is a sun terrace and pool - very rare in the city centre. The pool is more of a plunge pool than anything.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Good location, comfortable hotel
reviews.text: The only minor hotel complaint would be the reception staff - surly would not be in it! However if you let this ruin your trip then you're obviously usuing any excuse to find faults. The hotel bar and restaurant are always empty, only ever a few people in the bar later on at night as they return from the entertainment in the surrounding areas.
Overall the hotel was clean, quiet and excellent value for money. Barcelona is nice but not one of Europe's many gems. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Good central hotel
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I would like to tell you about the wonderful hotel we stayed at in Barcelona before our cruise from Barcelona port on 26 June 2006. The Hotel HCC Montblanc was a very good hotel. The location was superb and facilities were excellent. On arriving at the hotel we were given our room cards and also a voucher for a free glass of Cava in the Piano bar. We found our room which was very nice and it also had a exercise bike in it. The room was very clean and big enough for the two of us. Having a pool was a godsend as the temperature were high and after a day of sighseeing we could cool off by the pool. The hotel position is very close to all the sites and is just off Plaza Catalunya. Everytime you entered the hotel we were greeted with a hello and a smile. On the last day we were leaving the hotel at 2pm we asked if there was a room we could leave our bags as we were supposed to have checked out at 12 midday. We were immediately asked what time we were checking out and given permission to stay in the room until we did so. They very kindly phoned for a taxi to take us to the port. The breakfast was substantial and very filling and was available till 10.30. The only complaint I have is that the toaster was useless and just dried out the bread but there were plenty of rolls and sweet breads to choose from. If you want a good, clean hotel close to all of the sights chose this hotel.

I stayed in Montblanc for four days during the 3GSM World Congress in Barcelona. I'd would sincerely recommend this hotel for all the business travellers coming to congresses, conferences, seminars, etc. in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very nice choice for a business traveller
Excellent in every way...
reviews.text: Montblanc was just 10 minutes trip away from the Plaza Espanya and Fira de Barcelona. Taxi trip was something around 7--10 €, so I didn't have to bother using public transport. In case I had wanted to use that, the tram connection is quite close by.

For business traveller, easy access to Internet is definitely a big advantage. Montblanc delivers what it promises; all I had to do was plug my laptop to the network cable that was offered for free from the hotel reception.
reviews.title: very suprised by its low rating on tripadvisor

reviews.text: The room was decent, good air conditioning, TV, minibar and shower with warm water coming without problems.
reviews.title: Excellent location and good value for money
Great location!
reviews.text: Great stay. Wonderful rooftop/balcony views from our room. Room was just ok, but views made up for it. Great location, a couple blocks from the Ramabla and quiet, centrally located to everything.
Excellent location, presented nicely. Clean and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pool was lovely area to chill after long day shopping!
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.liked: — Can't specify as loved it all

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: Will definately return.

My wife and I, ( both 27) stayeed here for 4 days on our first trip to Spain. This hotel is centrally located between the Barri Gotic, and other neighborhoods, and on a major street, which made it very easy to walk to places for sight seeing. The room was smaller than we were used to, but we have only been in US hotels, not European. The room and hotel were clean, and had no problem with us checking in at 9:00 AM. I would definitely recommend this hotel both for price and location.
reviews.title: Clean but noisy
Comfortable room, great location.
reviews.text: We stayed at this 3 star hotel in central Barcelona for 3 nights July 2005. The hotel is at the top end of Via Laetina, just a short walk from Placa Catalunya and all it's transport connections. It's even closer to Urqinona metro stop on the red line. The top end of Las Ramblas is not far either.

Our room was one of the biggest standard rooms I have stayed in and was clean and tidy with a comfortable bed and adequate storage space. There was a modem point to connect your laptop to the internet if needed. There was a TV but CNN was the only English language channel.The bathroom was small but again clean and with a powerful shower. Our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking one of the narrow streets of the Barri Gothic. One night bins were being collected at 1 am, so it was quite noisy for a couple of minutes, this was a minor point over all.
reviews.title: Unfriendly staff, miniscule pool, some very dark rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Literally 5 mins ( I timed it) from Placa Catalunya, and the Aerobus terminal outside El Corte Ingles. Good sized room at rear - nice and quiet . Good sized bathroom and plenty of storage space, all spotlessly clean. Breakfast is an extensive cold buffet and dinner is based on a daily menu and a rather limited seasonal menu. We had dinner twice and found it to be excellent.Breakfast is 7 to 11 a.m. -very civilised ! ! .as is the 12 noon checkout. There is secure luggage storage for late departures. All the staff were friendly and helpful from reception to porters. We would definitely use the Mont blanc again.
reviews.title: Excellent Mont Blanc
Great location
reviews.text: Having just returned from three nights in this hotel with my wife, I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. Great location off Pl. Urquinaona and easy to reach on foot from Aerobus (bus which runs from airport to Pl.Catalunya 3.90euro). Room was a good size, bathroom excellent with bath and strong shower. The room was even equipped with a fitness bike (perhaps they were trying to tell us something ). The staff were very friendly and spoke English and the hotel was spotless. Didn't eat in hotel as there were many restaurants close by, one just around the corner called Cafe Reunion which had an upmarket feel with very reasonable prices.The only downside to the hotel was our room faced the street and there was a lot of traffic noise even with the double glazing. On checkout I mentioned this and was told if I had complained at the start, they would have changed me to a rear pool facing room. All in all very satisfied.
Just returned from three night stay at HCC Montblanc.
reviews.title: Terrific location

likes.disliked: — Seasonal turn-off of A/C, lack air circulation in room. (If this was a normal cool winter, probably would have been OK.)

reviews.title: Loved Barcelona
reviews.text: Could not have a better, more convenient location for wanting to do alot in a short time. Very easy to get to from the airport using the Aerobus to Pl Catalunya. Cost 3.75E at machine right outside door of arrivals hall. Bus every 10 minutes. Can also purchase ticket on board if you have correct change. Machine accepts Visa/MC etc cards. Hotel is less than5 minute walk from drop off point but not in the middle of the hustle bustle of the major shopping area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located on a busy street. If street noise (and it is a noisy street) will be an issue, ask for room at the back. Pleasant lobby area. There was an error in rooms assignment for our group but they quickly, pleasantly made necessary adjustment - everyone was happy.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel in Good Location

likes.disliked: — A little dated on the room interiors, could have used a small sitting area in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very central, clean and the staff were friendly. Unfortunately, we drew the short straw and ended up on the 6th floor with a room overlooking the main busy road. With no double glazing, we were kept awake all night by the heavy traffic. The next day we requested to swap rooms and were given a lovely ground floor room overlooking the pool which was lovely. But we must have picked the hen party weekend - as again the shouting in the middle of the night kept us up.
reviews.title: Good value and location, helpful staff

description: HCC Montblanc is situated right in the heart of the city, just 500 metres from Plaza Catalunya and bordering the charismatic Gótico neighbourhood. The hotel's location makes it the best choice for soaking up the atmosphere and life of Barcelona, and for discovering or revisiting its most emblematic corners, such as the Palau de la Música, the Ramblas, the Cathedral, Plaza Catalunya, the neighbourhoods of the Born and Barceloneta, among many others. Hotel HCC Montblanc is a new building, and has recently been extended. The hotel makes a good choice for a stay that is full of contrasts and unforgettable moments.
